course_main_structural_unit.address:
Narva mnt 18
51009 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Main notions of propositional calculus: tautology, logically equivalent formulae, disjunctive normal form of formulae. Set theory: Notion of a set, operations with sets, relations, relations of equivalence and partitions to the classes, cardinality of a set, ordered sets. Injective, surjective and bijective functions. Number theory: divisibility, division algorithm, fundamental theorem of arithmetic, infiniteness of the set of primes
description.et: Lausearvutuse põhimõisted: loogilised tehted, samaselt tõesed valemid, samaväärsed valemid, valemite järeldumine, täielik disjunktiivne normaalkuju. Hulgateooria põhimõisted: hulk, tehted hulkadega, seosed, ekvivalentsusseosed ja klassijaotused, hulga võimsus, järjestatud hulgad. Funktsiooni injektiivsus, sürjektiivsus, bijektiivsus. Arvuteooria põhimõisted: jaguvus, jäägiga jaguvus, aritmeetika põhiteoreem, algarvude hulga lõpmatus.

objectives.en: Giving first knowledge to the students about modern mathematics of application general notions and methods. Supporting the ability of critical thinking, developing mathematical oral self-expression skills.
objectives.et: Üliõpilastele esmaste teadmiste andmine kaasaegse matemaatika üldistest mõistetest, nende kasutamisharjumuste treenimine. Kriitilise mõtlemise oskuse toetamine, matemaatilise suulise eneseväljendusoskuse arendamine.

learning_outcomes.en: 1. know main notions of propositional calculus, set theory and number theory
learning_outcomes.et: 1. tunneb põhilisi lausearvutuse, hulgateooria ja arvuteooria mõisteid

learning_outcomes.en: 2. can use them in solving simple problems
learning_outcomes.et: 2. oskab neid kasutada lihtsamate ülesannete lahendamisel

learning_outcomes.en: 3. are prepared to use them in other disciplines
learning_outcomes.et: 3. on ette valmistunud nende mõistete kasutamiseks teistes õppeainetes

learning_outcomes.en: 4. can relate operations of propositional calculus with natural language propositions
learning_outcomes.et: 4. oskab seostada lausearvutuse tehteid loomuliku keele lausetega

learning_outcomes.en: 5. is familiar with different proof methods
6. know main notions of functions and relations and can use them in exercises
learning_outcomes.et: 6. tunneb põhilisi funktsioonide ja seostega seotud mõisteid ja oskab neid kasutada ülesannete lahendamisel

learning_outcomes.en: 7. know main notions of cardinalities of sets
learning_outcomes.et: 7. tunneb hulkade võimsusega seotud mõisteid, oskab määrata lihtsamate hulkade võimsuseid

learning_outcomes.en: 8. investigate and compile logic reasonings within the framework of course material
learning_outcomes.et: 8. uurib ja koostab loogilisi arutelusid kursuse käigus õpitud matemaatiliste kontseptsioonide raames

learning_outcomes.en: 9. have discussed on a mathematical conception (essence, proof, examples) in oral midterm and oral part of final exam
learning_outcomes.et: 9. on arutlenud suulisel vaheeksamil ja lõpueksami suulises osas matemaatilise kontseptsiooni olemuse, tõestuse ja näidete üle

notes.et: This English syllabus is choosable only for students of non-Estonian curricula, who do not speak Estonian. All Estonian-speaking students should choose Estonian syllabus of the same course.

independent_work.et:
Independently studying course notes and accompaniyng exercises in Moodle.
Homework assignments.

description.et: Exam consists of written and oral part

grade_preconditions.et: Student must acquire a required minimum amount of points (homework, test 1 and test 1, tests in Moodle, oral midterm) and exceed the corresponding threshold in order to participate in the final examination (exact requirements are in Moodle).

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade over all assignments is then determined as follows:

180 -... - excellent (A),
160 -179 - very good (B),
140 -159 - good (C),
120 -139 - satisfying (D),
100-119 - weak (E),
0-99 - deficient (F).

debt_elimination.et:
It is possible to redo both Test 1 and Test 2 again. In such case the last result is taken into account.
Homework assignments and the oral midterm cannot be redone.
It is possible to redo the final examination, but only in cases where the student did not participate for the first time or after the first try the final grade was deficient (F).

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

structural_unit.address:
Narva mnt 18
51009 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.et: Practical lessons 1-2. Introduction. Definitions, Theorems, Proofs. Assumptions and Claims. Mathematical Symbols.
Practical lessons 3-6. Propositional Logic (basic notations and concepts). Compound Propositions. Propositional Equivalences. Complete Disjunctive Normal Form.
Practical lessons 7-10. Sets (basic notations and concepts). Set Operations. Venn diagram. Properties of Set Operations.
Practical lessons 11-14. Introduction to Number Theory. Mathematical Induction.
Practical lessons 15-16. Introduction to Proofs. Proof Methods and Strategy.
Practical lessons 17-22. Functions (basic notations and concepts). One-to-One and Onto Functions. Bijections. Inverse Functions and Compositions of Functions. The Graphs of Functions.

Practical lessons 26-31. Relations (basic notations, concepts and operations). Representing Relations. Equivalence Relations. Equivalence Classes and Partitions. Partial Orderings. Hasse Diagrams. Maximal and Minimal Elements.
